name: onomatopoeically
content:

in a way that relates to onomatopoeia (= the act of creating or using words that include sounds that are similar to the noises the words refer to): Another name for the bird, the peewit, onomatopoeically conveys its call. All the invented creatures in the story have onomatopoeically derived names.
More examplesFewer examplesShe has a very distinctive singing style in which the words create a mood onomatopoeically.The poet onomatopoeically uses language that does not usually have an onomatopoeic function.I've always liked the word "murmur", as it works so well onomatopoeically.
